Vocabularies.Definition: n. 汽车后部的行李箱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The small car has no trunk at its back.

Vocabularies.Definition: have difficulty handling or coping with 费力地对付
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She struggled with the math problem but eventually worked it out.
e.g.  This small shop sells some groceries like salt, soy, spice, etc.
e.g.  The factory produces primarily diesel locomotives.
e.g.  The driver blew / sounded his horn when an old lady with her dog stepped in front of his car.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. , ad. 附近的；在附近
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She came from a nearby village.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 翘拇指(赞同或满意的表示)
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He held thumbs-up and expressed approval.
e.g.  Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. repeat (another's words, ideas, etc.) 重复
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They echoed their leader's every word.

Vocabularies.Definition: make sb. aware of (sth.) 引起(某人)注意
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The article was intended to draw the public's attention to environmental protection.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. rising or falling sharply 陡峭的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The castle is built on a steep hill.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. (knelt) go down on the knees; rest on the knees 跪下;跪着
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Everyone in church knelt in prayer.
e.g.  This aircraft company deals with freight only; it has no passenger service.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. above one's head; in the sky 在上头的;架空的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She turned on the overhead light and looked around the room.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  send (sth. such as a warning or a message) by a light or an act 发信号传达
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We signaled the taxi driver to pull over.
e.g.  Step out of the way and let me handle the stone.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. begin again after a pause 重新开始，恢复
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We resumed our work after a rest.

Vocabularies.Definition: prep. for each 每 e.g.  How much do you earn per week?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  How much do you earn per week?
e.g.  An accelerator is a device for increasing speed.
e.g.  The conductor announced the name of each station.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. coming halfway between; not extreme 中等的 n. a means which can be used to express or communicate sth. 媒质，媒介
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He is of medium height.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml) do things in an aimless way; spend time playing 随意做事;闲荡 mess vt. put into disorder 弄乱;弄脏 n. 混乱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He often likes to mess around with pals on days off.

Vocabularies.Definition: int. 嗨(用以唤起注意等) e.g.  Hey! Where are you going?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Hey! Where are you going?
e.g.  She is so angry now. Just leave her to cool down and then talk to her.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. see or recognize 看出，认出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Thank you for pointing out the error; I hadn't spotted it.
e.g.  He paused for an instant.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. with great attention 专心地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He does his homework intently after school every day.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 破布;抹布; (pl) 破旧衣服
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was clad in rags.
e.g.  His brakes failed on a slippery road.
e.g.  The child pulled on his mother's coat wanting to leave.
e.g.  She opened the door with all her strength and ran out of the house.
e.g.  The driver gave a blast on his horn.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. burst with a loud noise 爆发;爆炸
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The boiler exploded and a big fire ensued.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. (cause to) move or swing slowly from side to side (使)摇动;(使)摇摆
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The trees swayed in the wind.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. move very fast; produce a sudden bright light 飞驰，掠过;闪烁
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The cars flashed past.
e.g.  The scientists are able to calculate accurately when the spaceship will reach the moon.
e.g.  The harder the brake pedal is pressed, the greater the car's deceleration.
e.g.  The wounded man lay there groaning, with no one to help him.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. extremely loud 雷鸣似的; 极响的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His speech got thunderous applause.

Vocabularies.Definition: (leapt or leaped) vi. jump 跳，跃
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The dog leapt over the fence.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. seize suddenly; take roughly and quickly 猛地抓取
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He grabbed the coin and ran off.
e.g.  The blade of the kinfe is very keen.
e.g.  His tie was pulled loose and his collar hung open.
e.g.  The man picked up the hammer on the ground and hit the statue into pieces.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. fall or strike suddenly, violently, and noisily 突然重重倒下;坠毁;碰撞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The cars crashed into each other.

Vocabularies.Definition: stretch one's arm, usu. in order to get or touch (sth.) 伸手抓
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The mother reached out to grab her little boy but it was too late. He fell into the river.

Vocabularies.Definition: free from, not in contact with 离开;不接触
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  As soon as he was clear of the building he looked round.
e.g.  Scrape the mud off your shoes with this knife.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. at once; immediately 立即，即刻
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I instantly recognized her.
e.g.  He had a broad forehead.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. hit hard 猛击，用力击
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He punched him on the nose.
e.g.  nylon stockings/a nylon curtain

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 织物，织品;构造，结构
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She bought some fabric to make shirts from.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  great fear or shock 恐惧,震惊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was filled with horror at the sight.
e.g.  Window cleaners are pulled up and down tall buildings on cradles（吊蓝）.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. harm, hurt; damage 损害;伤害 injury n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There were two people injured in the car accident.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. hold tightly in one's arms 紧抱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He hugged his daughter.
e.g.  We all wore masks at the party and no one knew who we were.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. that can be seen 看得见的，可见的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The smoke from the fire was visible from the road.
e.g.  Twist the lid to open it.
e.g.  The ambulance is equipped with life-saving equipment.

Vocabularies.Definition: = madam 女士，小姐 e.g.  Can I help you, Ma'am?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Can I help you, Ma'am?

Vocabularies.Definition: prep. by means of; by way of 通过;经过
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We will fly to New York via Alaska.
e.g.  A beeper emits a beeping signal when the person carrying it is being paged（寻呼）.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of or in the inside 内部的;内在的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  the internal relations of things

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. like a miracle 奇迹般地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The soldiers won a victory in battle miraculously.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （缝合伤口、缝纫、刺绣等的）一针，针脚
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The dress was sewn with small stitches.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. put (sth.) in a dangerous position 使遭受危险 n. 危险，风险
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She risked her own life to help a disabled woman.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml) in no way; definitely not 不行;决不
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This remark should no way be taken lightly.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. sth. that happens 事情;事件 e.g.  Were there any exciting incidents during your journey?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Were there any exciting incidents during your journey?

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. protect; cover 保护;遮蔽 n.  隐蔽处;躲避处
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  That line of trees shelters my house from the wind.

Vocabularies.Definition: 联铁(一家主要在美国东北部营运的铁路公司, Consolidated Rail Corporation 的缩合词)
